intro: Aster fragilis var. tenuiculus, commonly known as the slender leaf aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of blue to purple. Its leaves are narrow and linear, contributing to its delicate appearance. This variety is noted for its ability to thrive in wet conditions, making it a valuable addition to wetland restoration projects.
